clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Cyclodextrin (SBECD) and Voriconazole Blood Concentrations During Continuous Dialysis
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Sulfobutylether-ß-cyclodextrin Sodium (SBECD) Accumulation and Voriconazole Pharmacokinetics in Patients Undergoing Continuous Renal Replacement Therapy

brief_summary.textblock: This study's primary objective is to determine if continuous renal replacement therapy (CRRT) can adequately remove the sulfobutylether-ß-cyclodextrin sodium (SBECD) vehicle from the blood so that intravenous voriconazole can be utilized in critically ill patients with renal dysfunction requiring dialysis. Secondarily, the pharmacokinetics of intravenous voriconazole and its metabolite (UK121-265) and adverse effects of SBECD accumulation will also be evaluated. The study hypothesis is that CRRT is effective at removing SBECD and allows patients to receive intravenous voriconazole without the concern of SBECD accumulation.

primary_outcome.measure: Determine SBECD plasma and effluent concentrations
primary_outcome.description: Evaluate SBECD pharmacokinetics (Cmax, Cmin, AUC, half-life, CL, seiving coefficient). Predict time to SBECD accumulation in study patients

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Adverse Events as a Measure of Safety and Tolerability
Determine Voriconazole and UK121-265 plasma and effluent concentrations
secondary_outcome.description: Voriconazole and UK121-265 Pharmacokinetics will be evaluated (Cmax, Cmin, AUC, elimination rate constant, half-life, CL, seiving coefficient) including determination and impact of any CYP2C19 mutations on plasma pharmacokinetic parameters

intervention.description: Patients will be started on voriconazole 6 mg/kg IV q12h on day 1, then 4 mg/kg IV q12h thereafter.

biospec_descr.textblock: Whole blood, serum, urine, effluent fluid from dialysis machine

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who are receiving continuous renal replacement therapy and are prescribed voriconazole therapy for the treatment or prophylaxis of a fungal infection.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients expected to be on CRRT for < 5 days,
- Patients with Child-Pugh C cirrhosis, and
- Patients who are pregnant.
